content.description: The first couple bolts of climbing are the crux. I would recommend stick clipping the first bolt, since the rock is not the best right here, and a fall before you clip the first bolt would be really ugly because of the position you are in.
content.location: This is the first route to the right of the crack.

content.description: This is second route from the left. It is protected by 6 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor. I felt the crux came at the 4th bolt, but it's a bit awkward getting to the 5th bolt as well. It is a decent warmup for the other routes in the area.
content.protection: 6 draws for the route and 2 draws for the anchor.

content.description:
This route is located just left of the mine and just right of

One Stick or Two

.  I thought this was a pretty nice route that required some technical footwork and crimpy holds/sidepulls.  I'm still not sure where the crux was, since the upper half of the route was pretty consistent.

Most people will want to stick clip the first bolt since this is the crux and a fall would be ugly. Once past the first bolt, the climbing becomes vertical and easier, but make sure to leave a little for the sting in the tail.
content.location: This is the second route right of the crack.

climbs.name: Rock Juice
climbs.fa: Josh Gross, BJ Sbarra, Lynn Sanson

content.description: This is a fun, cruxy route with 3 little boulder problems. At the 2nd to last bolt, climb right of loose feature (hollow flake) then back left to last bolt. The crux is mid-route!
content.location:
It is located just  right of

Master Blaster

.

content.description:
While cleaning this line, I peeled off a flake and underneath was a small but scary looking bat.  After giving me the stink eye, it flew off to new accommodations.

Climb through some initial choss to pleasant climbing above.
content.location:
Start just left of

One Stick Or Two

.

content.description: The bottom half of this route is very fun.  It is located directly above the mine shaft.  The crux comes between the 3rd and 4th bolt.  There is a triangle-shaped rock that juts out above you, and my partner found an intermediate hold while I had to throw for the jug.  Either way, it's fun.
content.location: It is directly above the mine shaft.
